intro: Strychnos balansae, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds covered in a fleshy aril. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky outcrops. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
